fields.headline: Home runs
fields.bodyText: There's new breed of intimate ski hostelry where you are looked after by the owner as a personal guest rather than as a paying customer. The house-guest atmosphere (most places here sleep 20-35) is ideal for families and nothing is too much trouble for the hosts. Some of the owners will take you skiing and on a variety of winter activities. Others produce home-cooked food, direct from the family farm. Hotel da Barba, Asiago in the Italian Dolomites What's special? Hotel da Barba is a homely, family-run three-star in the heart of Europe's largest cross-country ski area. Run by former cross-country champion, Giacomo Mosele, along with his two daughters and their husbands, this unsophisticated hotel has a cosy atmosphere with country cooking. The bedrooms are large and pretty. What else do they offer? 500km of cross-country trails. There are two ski lifts near the hotel, but the main downhill skiing is 30 minutes away at Gailo. The family will take their guests to the local ski factory to buy equipment at the best price, as well as driving them to different ski areas. Getting there: Fly to Venice, followed by an 85-minute rail journey then 40 minutes by taxi. How much? From £718pp one week half-board, including flights and transfers. Inntravel (01653 617906, inntravel.co.uk). Haus Senger, Heiligenblut, Carinthia, Austria What's special? Veteran ski racer Hans Senger and his wife create a welcoming atmosphere at the farmhouse-style hotel, which has 400-year-old reclaimed beams and planks, flagstone floors and open fires. What else do they offer? Some suites have kitchenettes - good for families. New wing with a health and fitness facilities blends in cleverly, and guests can ski straight into the Grossglockner area with its 13 lifts and 65km of runs. Because of good skiing conditions, the area has already opened. Getting there: Ryanair (0871 2460000, www.ryanair.com ) to Klagenfurt from £38pp return, followed by three-hour train journey to Heiligenblut. How much? £45-£69pp per day half-board. 0043 4824 2215, tiscover.at/haus-senger. Hotel Belvedere, Champex Lac, Switzerland What's special? It has established a cult following over the years. Owners, the Favré family, collect unusual objets d'art such as cowbells, puppets, and antique musical instruments, all of which are on display. What else do they offer? Sleepy Champex Lac has limited but demanding skiing with just four lifts. When the weather is bad, locals ignore neighbouring Verbier's exposed slopes and head for the powder on Champex's wooded slopes. Getting there: EasyJet (0871 7500100, www. easyjet.com) to Geneva from £45pp return, then hire car to the resort. How much? About £45pp per night half-board. 0041 27 783 1114, www.le-belvedere.ch . Hotel Spielmann, Ehrwald, Tyrol, Austria What's special? The hotel is an old Tyrolean house owned by the same family since the 17th century. The present owner and his son are both climbers, as well as accomplished chefs who use recipes from the grandmother's cookbook and ingredients from the family farm. What else do they offer? Children love the barns, playground and swimming pool. The Spielmanns take guests on ski tours and wildlife safaris. Getting there: Austrian Airlines (020-7766 0300, www.austrian airlines.co.uk ) to Innsbruck from £103pp rtn, followed by two-hour train journey to Ehrwald. How much? About £45-£65pp per night half-board. 0043 5673 22250, www.hotel-spielmann.com . The farmhouse, Munken, Sweden What's special? As well as spending time on skis or snowshoes, you can also glide across the snow on a sled pulled by huskies, go tobogganing or ice-fishing, then cook your catch over a campfire in a teepee. The farmhouse sleeps just eight in two pairs of interconnecting bedrooms, making it ideal for families. What else do they offer? This is Sweden's wilderness. With lakes and forest on the doorstep you can spot reindeer and maybe Arctic foxes. Getting there: Fly to Ostersund via Stockholm, followed by a 30-minute taxi ride. How much? From £738pp one week half-board, including flights and transfers. Inntravel 01653 617906 (www.inntravel.co.uk ).
